title: How to Make Traditional Japanese Miso Soup from Scratch

text: Preparing the Soup Base Put a piece of kelp into a bowl of water. Leave to soak for 1 hour. Boil the water containing the kelp.  Remove the boiling water from the heat. Remove the kelp. Put the dried bonito into this water. Boil again. Stop boiling and filter out all of the dried bonito.  Preparing the Soup Dissolve the miso in a little water. Add to the soup. Cut the tofu, spring onions and deep fried bean curd. Cut into small pieces suitable for the soup. Put the chopped ingredients into the miso soup. Heat again, gently. Do not boil the soup after you put miso in. Miso is not to be boiled at all in any soup, as to do so would destroy its nutrients. Finished. The miso soup is now ready for serving. Sprinkle a few fresh rounds of spring onions on top as a garnish.
